department: Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development (Department of)
short_summary: Require building maintenance services for the Canadian Embassy in Tunisia.
description: Per contract documents. Seek bids for a 3-year contract, with 2 optional years.
full_summary:
================================

**Building Maintenance Services**
================================

### Description

Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development (DFATD) is seeking a contractor to provide building maintenance services at the Embassy of Canada in Tunis, Tunisia. The successful bidder will be responsible for preventative and corrective maintenance operations, including repair work, and will provide various services in accordance with the requirements of the Statement of Work (Annex A).

### Contract Period and Start Date

The contract will be valid for three firm years, plus two optional years. The anticipated start date is December 1, 2022. 

### Security Requirements

The successful bidder must ensure that personnel performing work at the mission premises obtain a valid personnel security screening level of RELIABILITY STATUS from Canadian security authorities.

### Tender Information

* **Publication Date:** September 30, 2022
* **Tender Closing Date:** November 11, 2022, at 14:00 hours (Ottawa, Ontario time)
* **Amendment Date:** November 1, 2022
* **Tender Status:** Expired

### Contact Information

Contact person: Irena Stevic
Email: irena.stevic@international.gc.ca
Phone: 343-203-2582
Address: 200 Promenade du Portage, Gatineau, QC, K1A 0G4

### Documents

The following documents are available for download: 
* [English version of the Contract](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents/pub/att/2022/09/30/ccd567a86571a32c1b6ed9ab2430cf03/22-198066_-_annex_a_sow_-_eng.pdf)
* [French version of the Contract](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents/pub/att/2022/09/30/de9c6d67e30a5ce2d102d57d8bee05f8/22-198066_-_annex_d_-_srcl.pdf)
* [Request for Proposal](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents/pub/att/2022/09/30/9447af4c464aafea7f3c771ff11fe829/22-198066_-_rfp_eng.pdf)

Please note that this tender announcement has expired. 
- The solicitation process is now closed.
- The government entity is no longer accepting proposals. 
- Any trader participation is now prohibited.
